definitions.text: approaching a particular destination; a coming closer; a narrowing of a gap
examples: the ship's rapid rate of closing gave them little time to avoid a collision

definitions.text: a rule for limiting or ending debate in a deliberative body
a Gestalt principle of organization holding that there is an innate tendency to perceive incomplete objects as complete and to close or fill gaps and to perceive asymmetric stimuli as symmetric
something settled or resolved; the outcome of decision making
examples: they finally reached a settlement with the union
they never did achieve a final resolution of their differences
he needed to grieve before he could achieve a sense of closure

definitions.text: an obstruction in a pipe or tube
examples: we had to call a plumber to clear out the blockage in the drainpipe
they regretted the closure of the day care center

definitions.text: terminate debate by calling for a vote
